title: Latin America : minimum monthly wages in 2019 , by country
yAxis: Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars
summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars is appeared to be the highest at Country Uruguay and lowest at Country Venezuela.
The highest Country Uruguay has 455.3 more Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars than the lowest Country Venezuela.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars in the y axis.
Country Uruguay has the highest Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars and Venezuela has the lowest Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars is appeared to be the highest at Country Uruguay and lowest at Country Venezuela.
The highest Country Uruguay has 455.3 more Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars than the lowest Country Venezuela.
max_summary: This bar chart has 11 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars in each Country on the y axis.
Country Uruguay has the highest Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars and Venezuela has the lowest Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars.
The second highest Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars is appeared to be the Country Chile.
There is a difference of 455.3 between the maximum Country Uruguay and minimum Country Venezuela.
Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars at Country Uruguay is 462.3 , second place is Chile at 431.7, and thirdly is Ecuador at 394.0.
Considered together, the average Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars in all 11 Countrys is roughly 290.1.
The Monthly minimum wage in U.S. dollars is 3191.1 if we add up values of all Countrys.
